# Procurement Management Plan

## 1. Introduction

This Procurement Management Plan defines the approach, processes, and responsibilities for procurement activities on the **Requirements Gathering Agent** project. It ensures that all purchases and acquisitions of products, services, and resources needed for the successful completion of the project are managed effectively, aligned with organizational policies, and compliant with PMBOK guidelines.

---

## 2. Procurement Objectives

- To acquire necessary external products and services for the AI-powered requirements gathering and PMBOK documentation automation tool.
- To establish clear vendor selection, contract management, and procurement monitoring processes.
- To mitigate procurement risks and ensure timely delivery of vendor deliverables.
- To maintain alignment with enterprise security standards such as Azure Entra ID authentication and compliance requirements.
- To optimize costs while ensuring quality and reliability through multi-provider AI support.

---

## 3. Procurement Roles and Responsibilities

| Role                    | Responsibility                                                |
|-------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
| Project Manager         | Overall procurement oversight, vendor communication, approvals, and integration with project schedule. |
| Procurement Specialist  | Manage procurement documentation, vendor evaluation, and contract execution. |
| Legal Counsel           | Review and approve contracts and legal compliance.            |
| Finance Manager         | Budget oversight, payment processing, and cost tracking.       |
| Technical Lead          | Define technical requirements and evaluate vendor technical capabilities. |
| Quality Assurance Lead  | Ensure procured products/services meet quality standards.      |

---

## 4. Procurement Requirements

- AI service providers supporting multiple platforms (Azure OpenAI, GitHub AI, Ollama, Azure AI Studio).
- Licensing and API access for AI models per usage requirements.
- Security and compliance adherence (e.g., Azure Entra ID integration).
- Support and maintenance agreements for critical components.
- Documentation and training materials from vendors if applicable.

---

## 5. Make-or-Buy Analysis

| Item/Service                         | Make (In-House) | Buy (Procure) | Rationale                              |
|------------------------------------|-----------------|---------------|--------------------------------------|
| AI model access and API integration| No              | Yes           | Use commercial AI providers for reliability and scalability. |
| Local AI support (Ollama)           | No              | Yes           | Use existing local AI infrastructure rather than developing from scratch. |
| PMBOK documentation templates       | Yes             | No            | Developed in-house to align with project-specific requirements. |
| Security and authentication setup   | Yes             | No            | Managed internally to comply with enterprise security policies. |

---

## 6. Procurement Strategy

- **Source Selection:** Utilize a multi-provider AI strategy to avoid vendor lock-in and ensure failover capabilities.
- **Vendor Evaluation Criteria:** Technical capability, security compliance, cost, SLA terms, support quality, and vendor reputation.
- **Contract Types:** Fixed-price contracts for defined services; time and materials for ongoing support.
- **Procurement Method:** Competitive bidding for major contracts; direct purchase or subscription for API services.
- **Legal and Compliance:** Contracts must comply with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.

---

## 7. Procurement Process

### 7.1 Plan Procurement

- Identify procurement needs based on project scope and technology stack requirements.
- Define procurement documents: Requests for Information (RFI), Requests for Proposal (RFP), or Requests for Quotation (RFQ).
- Establish evaluation criteria and scoring methodology.

### 7.2 Conduct Procurement

- Issue procurement documents to potential vendors.
- Collect and evaluate vendor proposals.
- Negotiate terms, pricing, and SLAs.
- Obtain internal approvals for vendor selections.

### 7.3 Control Procurement

- Monitor vendor performance against contract terms.
- Manage changes in scope or deliverables via formal change control.
- Track procurement costs and schedule impacts.
- Manage vendor payments and contract closure.

---

## 8. Procurement Schedule

| Procurement Item             | Start Date  | End Date    | Responsible Party    | Status      |
|-----------------------------|-------------|-------------|---------------------|-------------|
| AI Provider API Licensing    | Project Start | Month 1    | Procurement Specialist | Planned     |
| Local Ollama AI Setup        | Month 1     | Month 2     | Technical Lead      | Planned     |
| Contract Negotiation with Vendors | Month 1 | Month 3    | Project Manager     | Planned     |
| Ongoing Support Agreements   | Month 3     | Ongoing     | Procurement Specialist | Planned   |

## 9. Procurement Budget

- AI API subscriptions and licensing: $XX,XXX
- Vendor contracts for consulting/support: $XX,XXX
- Contingency reserve for procurement changes: $X,XXX

> *Actual figures to be finalized based on vendor proposals and organizational budgeting.*

---

## 10. Vendor Management and Communication

- Establish a single point of contact for vendor communication.
- Schedule regular vendor performance reviews.
- Use collaboration tools for contract and documentation sharing.
- Maintain a vendor contact and contract repository.

---

## 11. Risk Management in Procurement

| Risk                          | Likelihood | Impact | Mitigation Strategy                                  |
|-------------------------------|------------|--------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| Vendor delays in delivering AI service access | Medium     | High   | Establish SLAs with penalties; identify backup providers. |
| Contract disputes or misunderstandings         | Low        | Medium | Legal review of contracts; clear scope and deliverables. |
| Cost overruns due to changing requirements     | Medium     | Medium | Change control process for procurement scope.           |
| Security or compliance breaches by vendors      | Low        | High   | Vendor security assessments; enforce compliance clauses.|

---

## 12. Procurement Documentation

- Procurement Management Plan (this document)
- Vendor proposals and evaluation records
- Signed contracts and agreements
- Purchase orders and invoices
- Vendor performance reports
